question: Select the best statement among the following
options: a) Your system is secure if it is obscure enough for an attacker to figure out
b) Assume the system is known to the attacker but do not reveal tactical defence details
c) Reveal everything you have about your system to the world
correct_answers: b) Assume the system is known to the attacker but do not reveal tactical defence details

question: To make sure the receiver of a message you are sending can verify the integrity of the message content
options: a) You encrypt it with your public key before sending it
b) You encrypt it with your private key before sending it
c) You hash it first, then encrypt the hash with your public key and send the encrypted hash with the message
d) You hash it first, then you send the hash with the message
correct_answers: d) You hash it first, then you send the hash with the message

question: To make sure the receiver of message you are sending can verify the identity of the sender
options: a) You encrypt it with your public key before sending it
b) You encrypt it with your private key before sending it
c) You hash it first, then encrypt the hash with your private key and send the encrypted hash with the message
d) You hash it first, then you send the hash with the message
correct_answers: c) You hash it first, then encrypt the hash with your private key and send the encrypted hash with the message

question: Public Key Cryptography requires
options: b) One secret key that both parties know
c) A public key and a private key
correct_answers: c) A public key and a private key
